title: American_Top_40_1984_December_1st
description:
"And the countdown continues now on American Top 40 with the twenty hottest hits in the USA still to come. I'm Casey Kasem and on we go."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

A listener wants to know if any TV game show hosts have hit the top 40. Casey says no, but lists five top 40 artists later became hosts on game shows.

Casey answers the question, "What recording artist has hit the top 40 on the most record labels?" Casey says it's a three-way tie and each artist has been represented by nine different labels, and they were all once in the same group.

Two listeners ask the same question, "What act has had the most hits on the Dance and Disco Chart?" The act in first place has been called the "Queen of Disco" and has (as of this countdown) more than twice as many number ones as the act in second place.

Casey profiles Nile Rogers, a man who switched from studying thermonuclear hydrodynamics to write one of the biggest disco hits ever.

This week marks Cyndi Lauper's 45th consecutive week in the top 40 with various hits, putting her in third place among female singers with the most consecutive weeks in the top 40.

LW#1: Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go - Wham
